popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning

Class FNPTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning.FNPTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable, ComparableTaskObject, TaskObject, PoolableObjectIntf

    public class FNPTask
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComparableTaskObject, PoolableObjectIntf
    class implements the CKK algorithm (Complete Karmarkar-Karp Algorithm) for 2-way Number Partitioning, due to Richard Korf (1997). This class is almost the same as NPTask except that it implements also the Thread-Local Object-Pool design pattern found in other places in this library as well. Since the run() main method delegates to the runAux(depth) method, which in turn sometimes creates new FNPTask objects, and submits them to an asynchronous priority batch task executor, to be able to reclaim such objects without any locking, we resort to the creation of special ReleaseFNPTaskObject objects, that are also submitted to the same executor, that when executed, will force the executor to delete the FNPTask object they encapsulate on the same thread that the object was created, which necessarily increases the complexity of the overall program. To see the difference between having the ThreadLocal Object Pool (TLOP) and not having it, run the program with the following two parameter sets: 1. java ... 40 10000000000000 8 13 7 1 20 // this is with the TLOP this runs in about 69 seconds on a T530 laptop. 2. java ... 40 10000000000000 8 13 7 1 20 10 // force a pool size of size 10 - essentially non-existent this runs in about 217 seconds on the same laptop.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2014-2015

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public long getId()
        returns the _myid data member, which is unique among all tasks that are actually submitted to the executor but not among all FNPTask objects.
        Returns:
        long

      • run

        public java.io.Serializable run()
        this is the method that the executor executes (implementing the run() method of the ComparableTaskObject interface that the class implements). It usually creates two more FNPTask objects, one corresponding to the decision to keep the two top numbers together, and the other to keep them apart. Then, the two new tasks have to be executed as well, recursively (but may well be submitted to the same executor, one of whose threads is currently executing this task.)
        Specified by:
        run in interface TaskObject
        Returns:
        Serializable not used.

      • cloneObject

        public PoolableObjectIntf cloneObject()

        indicate item is available for re-use by Object-Pool to which it belongs, and resets its "major" data IFF it is a managed object. Otherwise, it's a no-op.

      • newInstance

        public static FNPTask newInstance(int n,
                                  int sz)
        this factory method shall first try to obtain an object from the thread- local object pool of FNPTask objects (as long as the _USE_POOLS compile-time constant flag is true), and if it can't find one (or if the _USE_POOLS flag is false), it will then produce an unmanaged one. The _descNumbers array will have length n, and the _sz member will be set to the 2nd arg.
        Parameters:
        n - int the _descNumbers array length
        sz - int the upper bound of the array (usable size)
        Returns:
        FNPTask

        Parameters:
        args - String[]
